questions.prompt: How would you explain REST APIs to a product manager, including the key principles that make them work?
scenario_seeds: Your product manager asks why your team chose REST over GraphQL for the new mobile app backend. Explain REST's benefits in business terms.
A stakeholder is confused why different services can communicate with your API. Explain how REST's uniform interface enables this.
You're presenting your API design to non-technical leadership. Make REST principles accessible without jargon.
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain that REST uses HTTP and standard methods AND that it's stateless (each request contains all needed info) AND describe resources/endpoints as the core abstraction.

questions.prompt: Walk me through the HTTP methods GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE and when you'd use each one.
scenario_seeds: You're designing an API for a todo app. Map out which HTTP methods handle creating, viewing, updating, and deleting tasks.
A junior developer used POST for everything in their API. Explain why using the right HTTP methods matters.
Your team is debating whether to use PUT or POST for updating user profiles. Walk through the semantic differences.
questions.grading_rubric: Must correctly map GET to read, POST to create, PUT to update/replace, DELETE to remove AND explain idempotency differences AND relate to CRUD operations.
